item.title: VinFast 寻求 2.5 亿美元银行贷款在印尼建厂
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，越南电动汽车制造商 VinFast Auto Ltd. 正在寻求约 2.5 亿美元的银行贷款，以资助其在印度尼西亚梳邦的组装厂的建设。【原文：VinFast Auto Ltd., a Vietnamese electric vehicle maker, is looking for a bank loan of about $250 million to fund construction of its assembly plant in Subang in Indonesia, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 沙特阿美启动三年来首次美元债券销售
item.description: 沙特石油公司（Saudi Aramco）开始出售三重美元债务，扩大了这个石油王国的债务狂潮，因为它正在引入现金来帮助为项目提供资金。【原文：Saudi Aramco started the sale of triple-tranche dollar debt, extending the oil-rich kingdom’s debt spree as it brings in cash to help fund projects.】

item.title: 安赛乐米塔尔南非长材扩建工程促进经济发展
item.description: 制造圈执行董事 Philippa Rodseth 表示，安赛乐米塔尔南非有限公司决定继续运营其长钢设备，这为南非提供了一个重振本地制造业的机会。【原文：ArcelorMittal South Africa Ltd.’s decision to continue operating its long-steel unit has given the country an opportunity to re-energize local manufacturing, Manufacturing Circle Executive Director Philippa Rodseth said.】

item.title: 德国上半年初创企业增长 15
item.description: 与去年相比，德国初创企业数量激增，据德国初创企业协会报告，上半年初创企业数量增长了 15%。软件是关键所在，新创企业数量空前，占总数的五分之一。这一趋势是由数字化和人工智能的使用增加所推动的。【原文：Germany saw a surge in startup companies compared with last year, with 15% increase recorded in the first half reported by the country’s startup association. Software was key, with an unprecedented number of businesses created, accounting for a fifth of the total. That trend was driven by increased digitalization and use of artificial intelligence.】

item.title: 阿拉比卡咖啡接近两年高点，烘焙商发出价格警告
item.description: 随着供应担忧加剧，阿拉比卡咖啡期货价格接近两年高点，有可能推高消费者购买咖啡因的成本。【原文：Arabica coffee futures held near a two-year high as supply concerns mount, threatening to drive up the cost of consumers’ caffeine fix.】

item.title: 欧洲央行武伊契奇被提议连任克罗地亚央行行长
item.description: 克罗地亚央行行长鲍里斯-武伊契奇（Boris Vujcic）有望连任第三个六年任期，从而结束了他在克罗地亚议会选举后在央行前途未卜的局面。【原文：Croatian central-bank Governor Boris Vujcic is on course to be reappointed for a third six-year term, ending uncertainty about his future at the bank following parliamentary elections in his homeland.】

item.title: 波兰货币政策委员会主席科恰尔斯基称波兰可能从 3 月开始降息谈判
item.description: 波兰央行决策者 Cezary Kochalski 表示，波兰央行最新的通胀和经济增长预测实际上排除了至少在明年 3 月之前讨论降息的可能性。【原文：The Polish central bank’s latest inflation and growth forecasts effectively rule out discussions on lowering interest rates at least until next March, policymaker Cezary Kochalski said.】

item.title: 印度股市在创下历史新高后稍事喘息
item.description: 印度股票基准在上一交易日创下历史新高后下跌，原因是投资者对一家主要汽车制造商的降价以及即将到来的财报季进行了评估。【原文：India’s stock benchmark fell after hitting a record high in the previous session, as investors assessed price cuts by a key automaker and upcoming earnings season.】

item.title: PGIM 为首次发行的澳大利亚房地产债务基金筹资 5 亿澳元
item.description: PGIM 公司正在为其首个澳大利亚房地产债务基金募集 7.5 亿澳元（约 5 亿美元）资金，以满足该国因传统贷款人撤退而日益增长的需求。【原文：PGIM Inc., is raising A$750 million (about $500 million) for its first Australian real estate debt fund to fill a growing need in the country as traditional lenders retreat.】

item.title: 香港豪宅单笔成交价达 1.41 亿美元
item.description: 山顶上的四栋房屋以 11 亿港元（1.41 亿美元）的价格售出，成为自今年 2 月政府取消房地产限制以来最大的单笔交易。【原文：Four houses on the Peak have been sold for HK$1.1 billion ($141 million), making it the largest single transaction since the government removed property curbs in February.】

item.title: 普华永道失去数十家客户后开始在中国大规模裁员
item.description: 据知情人士透露，普华永道会计师事务所（PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP）正在裁减其中国业务部门的员工，因为企业客户的外流削弱了该会计师事务所在中国的收入前景。【原文：PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP is cutting staff across its China operations, according to people familiar with the matter, after an exodus of corporate clients diminished the accounting firm’s revenue prospects in the country.】

item.title: 马来西亚称即将与新加坡就经济特区达成协议
item.description: 马来西亚表示，它即将与新加坡达成协议，开发东南亚首个跨境经济特区，两国希望这将吸引新的投资并刺激经济增长。【原文：Malaysia said it’s near a deal with Singapore to develop Southeast Asia’s first cross-border special economic zone, which the countries hope will lure new investment and spur growth.】

item.title: 国家支持的债务堆积给意大利重组带来痛苦
item.description: 意大利政府在大流行病期间和之后为国家支持的贷款提供担保时，很少考虑到潜在的拖欠问题。现在，这种情况又出现了。【原文：When Italy’s government extended guarantees on state-backed loans during and after the pandemic, little thought was given to potential delinquencies. Now that’s coming back to bite.】

item.title: 埃及通胀在第四个月放缓，摆脱了面包价格上涨的影响
item.description: 6 月份，埃及通货膨胀率连续第四个月放缓，摆脱了养活大部分人口的补贴面包成本历史性上涨的影响。【原文：Egyptian inflation slowed for a fourth month in June, shrugging off the impact of a historic hike in the cost of subsidized bread that feeds a majority of the population.】

item.title: 哈贝克称德国将防止中国控制风力涡轮机数据
item.description: 德国副总理罗伯特-哈贝克（Robert Habeck）表示，他希望防止中国控制风力涡轮机数据。【原文：German Vice Chancellor Robert Habeck said he wants to prevent China from gaining control over wind-turbine data.】

item.title: 富时 100 指数直播：股市三连跌后有望反弹

item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，横滨橡胶公司（Yokohama Rubber Co.【原文：Yokohama Rubber Co. is in advanced talks to buy Goodyear Tire & Rubber Co.’s Off-the-Road tire business for at least $1 billion, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 日元和人民币相关性走近是亚洲货币的危险信号
item.description: 亚洲最重要的两种货币正以前所未有的态势齐头并进，在美元持续走强的情况下，这两种货币广泛下跌的风险正在增加。【原文：Asia’s two most important currencies are moving together like never before, increasing the risk of a broad decline among their regional peers amid the relentless strength of the dollar.】

item.title: 数十艘受制裁的俄罗斯油轮在世界各地闲置
item.description: 从俄罗斯波罗的海的寒冷水域到海参崴的太平洋沿岸，以前为莫斯科运送石油的几十艘油轮如今空空如也，闲置在那里。【原文：From the frigid waters of Russia’s Baltic Sea to the Pacific shores of Vladivostok, dozens of tankers that previously moved Moscow’s oil are now sitting empty and idle.】

item.title: 印度首次公开募股因快速回报的诱惑不断吸引个人投资者
item.description: 由于新股的高涨幅超过了大盘和海外上市，预计散户投资者今年将继续涌入印度的首次公开发行股票市场。【原文：Retail investors are expected to keep piling into initial public offerings in India this year, as hefty gains for new stocks outpace the broader market and listings abroad.】

item.title: 机构投资者将参与日本央行债券购买辩论
item.description: 在日本大型银行周二呼吁全面削减债券购买量之后，机构投资者周三将对日本央行的债券购买量进行讨论。【原文：Institutional investors will weigh into the debate on the Bank of Japan’s bond buying Wednesday after the nation’s megabanks on Tuesday called for sweeping cuts to purchases.】

item.title: 印度 Sensex 指数和 Nifty 50 指数创下新纪录，但消费类股票退出市场反弹行情
item.description: 在交易日开始之前，我们为您带来可能影响市场的重要新闻和事件摘要。【原文：Before the trading day starts we bring you a digest of the key news and events that are likely to move markets.】

item.title: 摩根大通将比亚迪目标价上调 80% 以上以展望未来
item.description: 摩根大通（JPMorgan Chase & Co.）的分析师将比亚迪公司的目标股价上调了80%以上，因为预计这家中国汽车制造商将在未来两年内向全球交付600万辆汽车。【原文：JPMorgan Chase & Co.’s analysts raised their price targets for BYD Co. by more than 80% on expectations the Chinese automaker will deliver 6 million vehicles globally in the next two years.】

item.title: 昂贵的可可供应即将冲击巧克力制造商，刺激需求回落
item.description: 上一季度可可加工可能略有放缓，但随着巧克力生产商开始真正感受到价格昂贵的可可豆带来的压力，可可加工将出现更大幅度的下滑。【原文：Cocoa processing likely slowed a bit last quarter, but a steeper slump is looming as chocolatiers start to really feel the pinch of pricey beans.】

item.title: 董事长与当局会面，新加坡上市公司野马汽车创 2021 年以来最大跌幅
item.description: 在新加坡上市的优玛战略控股有限公司（Yoma Strategic Holdings Ltd.）称其董事长塞尔吉-潘（Serge Pun）正在与缅甸当局合作后，该公司股价创下三年多来最大跌幅。【原文：Singapore-listed shares of Yoma Strategic Holdings Ltd. plunged the most in over three years after the company said its chairman Serge Pun is cooperating with Myanmar authorities.】

item.title: 中国居民消费价格回升但通缩压力犹存
item.description: 6 月份，中国居民消费价格再次小幅上涨，连续第五个月徘徊在零点附近，这表明通货紧缩压力继续阻碍经济复苏。【原文：China’s consumer prices eked out another small gain in June, hovering near zero for a fifth month, a sign that deflationary pressures continue to impede an economic recovery.】

item.title: 新加坡股指有望创下 2018 年新高
item.description: 在即将到来的财报季之前，投资者的乐观情绪升温，新加坡股市有望创下六年来的新高。【原文：Singapore’s stocks are poised for a six-year high as investor optimism rises ahead of the upcoming earnings season.】

item.title: 前摩根士丹利银行家基金融资 34 亿美元，击败亚洲竞争对手
item.description: 一位熟悉内情的人士称，由前摩根士丹利银行家创立的韩国收购公司 Hahn & Co.【原文：Hahn & Co., a South Korea buyout firm founded by an ex-Morgan Stanley banker, raised $3.4 billion to close what is the biggest fund in Asia targeting one country this year, a person familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: Indeed 公司宣布回购 37 亿美元后股价大涨
item.description: Recruit Holdings Co.创下了两个月来的最大涨幅，因为这家全球最大的招聘门户网站背后的公司表示，将回购价值高达 6000 亿日元（37 亿美元）的自有股票。【原文：Recruit Holdings Co. rose the most in two months after the company behind the world’s largest employment portal said it would buy back as much as ¥600 billion ($3.7 billion) worth of its own shares.】
